p: The results of multiplex PCR for the two groups of primer pairs yielded similar products, both of which were designed to identify C. crispus. In the first group, a 323 bp band was found in C. crispus, whereas a 421 bp band was identified in C. acanthoides and C. tenuiflorus ( Fig. 5A). By contrast, the combination of matK_463F, matK_1162R, CD_SNP_F2, and CD_SNP_R2 yielded a longer PCR product for C. crispus in comparison with the other species ( Fig. 5B). The designed primer pairs were specific to all C. crispus samples examined in this study ( Figs. S5 and S6).
